description: From rebracketing of phrases an uncle, mine uncle, thine uncle, etc. Compare neam and naunt.
For the verb, OED suggests an evolution in sense "to claim to be one's uncle" > "to cheat". It compares this derivation with cozen, which it derives from cousin.

verbs.description: nuncle (third-person singular simple present nuncles, present participle nuncling, simple past and past participle nuncled)
